2311140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311140
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 001
2311140.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "I think that answering a letter is a duty, just like returning the greeting."

2311150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311150
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 002
2311150.text: 'A'isha bint Talha said, "I spoke to 'A'isha when I was under her protection. people used to visit her from all places. Shaykhs used visit me because of my place with her. Young men used to treat me as a sister and give me presents and write to me from their cities. I said to 'A'isha, 'Aunt, this is a letter from so-and-so and his gift.' 'A'isha told me, 'My girl, answer him and reward him. If you do not have anything to give, I will give you something.' She told her to give it to her."

2311160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311160
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 003
2311160.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar wrote to 'Abdu'l-Malik ibn Marwan in order to pledge him his allegiance. He wrote to him, "In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful. To 'Abdu'l-Malik, the Amir al-Mu'minin, from 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar. Peace be upon you. I praise Allah to you. There is no god but Him. I offer you obedience according to the sunna of Allah and the sunna of His Messenger as much as I can."

2311170.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311170
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 004
2311170.text: Zayd ibn Aslam said, "My father sent me to Ibn 'Umar and I saw him write, 'In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful. Following on from that'"

2311180.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311180
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 005
2311180.text: Hisham ibn 'Urwa said, "I saw some of the letters of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. After the introduction he said, 'Following on from that'"

2311190.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311190
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 006
2311190.text: "In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful. To the slave of Allah, Mu'awiya, the Amir al-Mu'minin, from Zayd ibn Thabit. Peace be upon you, Amir al-Mu'minin, and the mercy of Allah. I praise Allah to you. There is no god but Him. Following on from that'"

2311200.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311200
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 007
2311200.text: Abu Mas'ud al-Jurayri related to him that a man asked al-Hasan about reading, "In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful." He said, "That should be put at the beginning of letters."

2311210.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311210
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 008
2311210.text: Nafi' said, "Ibn 'Umar needed something from Mu'awiya and he wanted to write to him. People said, 'Begin with his name.' They kept on at him until he wrote, 'In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful, to Mu'awiya.'"

2311220.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311220
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 009
2311220.text: "In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful. Following on from that: To so-and-so."'"

2311230.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311230
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 010
2311230.text: 'In the Name of Allah. It is for Him.'"

2311250.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311250
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 012
2311250.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'A man from the tribe of Israel - and he mentioned the entire hadith - had his friend write to him, 'From so-and-so to so-and-so.'"

2311260.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311260
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 013
2311260.text: Mahmud ibn Labid said, "When Sa'd's eye was gravely wounded in the Battle of the Ditch, they moved him to the house of a woman called Rufayda who used to treat the wounded. When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed by him, he would inquire, 'How are you this evening?' and in the morning, 'How are you this morning?' and he would tell him."

2311270.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311270
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 014
2311270.text: It is related from Ka'b ibn Malik, who was one of the three to whom Allah turned that Ibn 'Abbas informed him that 'Ali ibn Abi Talib emerged from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in his illness from which he died and the people said, "O Abu'l-Hasan! How is the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, this morning?" He said, "Praise be to Allah, he is well this morning." 'Abbas ibn 'Abdu'l-Muttalib took him by the hand and said to him, "By Allah, in three days time you will be a subject. By Allah, I think that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, will die of this illness. I recognise death in the faces of the Banu Abdu'l-Muttalib when they are dying. Let us go to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and ask him who will have this authority. If it is for us, then we will know that, and if it is for other than us, we will know it and he can advise him to look after us." 'Ali replied, "By Allah, if we ask him for it and he refuses us, then the people would never give it to us afterwards. By Allah, I will not ask it from the Messenger of Allah."

2311280.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311280
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 015
2311280.text: "In the Name of Allah, the All-Merciful, Most Merciful. To the slave of Prophet, Mu'awiya, the Amir al-Mu'minin, from Zayd ibn Thabit. Peace be upon you, Amir al-Mu'minin, and the mercy of Allah. I praise Allah to you. There is no god but Him. Following on from that, you asked me about the inheritance of the grandfather and brothers (and he mentioned the letter). We ask Allah for guidance, preservation and firmness in all our affairs. We seek refuge with Allah from being misguided or ignorant or taking on what we have no knowledge of. Peace be upon you, Amir al-Mu'minin, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings and His forgiveness. Wuhayb has written it on Thursday, the 20th Ramadan, 42 (AH)."

2311290.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311290
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 016
2311290.text: This is what I wanted to hear from you."

2311300.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311300
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 017
2311300.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked, "How are you this morning?" He replied, "Well. Away from people who do not attend funerals or visit sick people."

2311310.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311310
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 018
2311310.text: Muhajir (who is as-Sa'igh) said, "I was sitting with one of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, called Dakhm, from al-Hadramaym. When someone asked him, 'How are you this morning?' Dakhm replied, 'We do not associate anything with Allah.'"

2311320.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2311320
In-book reference  : Book 45, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 45, Hadith 019
2311320.text: Sayf ibn Wahb reported that Abu't-Tufayl asked him, "How old are you?" "Thirty-three years old," he replied. He said, "Shall I tell you a hadith which I heard from Hudhayfa ibn al-Yaman? A man from Muharib ibn Khasafa called 'Amr ibn Sulay', a Companion, was my age on that day and I was your age. Hudhayfa came to us in the mosque and sat at the edge of the people. 'Amr went over until he was standing in front of him and asked, 'How are you this morning (or evening), slave of Allah?' Hudhayfa said, 'I praise Allah.' 'Amr said, 'What are these hadiths which have come to us from you?' Hudhayfa said, 'What have you heard from me, 'Amr?' He said, 'Hadiths which I have not heard from anywhere else.' Hudhayfa said, 'By Allah, if I were to relate to you all that I have heard, you would be here with me until the middle of the night. 'Amr ibn Sulay', if you see Qays taking control of Syria, then beware and again beware. By Allah, Qays will not leave a believing slave of Allah without causing him to be in a state of fear or killing him. By Allah, a time will come to you in which the flood will not be stopped.' He said, 'Then what will help you against your people, may Allah have mercy on you?' He said, 'That is my business.' Then he sat down."
